summary: Email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York discussing plans to meet with individuals who previously worked with Jeffrey Epstein and may have information about coercive sexual encounters, and referencing a subpoena for publicist R. Couri Hay who had recent conversations with Epstein about his reputation.

persons.name: Mlir
persons.context: Primary recipient of the email from the Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding investigative coordination.

persons.name: Min .S
persons.context: Copied on the email discussing Epstein investigation matters.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the investigation; referenced regarding his prior conduct, conviction, and conversations about his reputation.

persons.name: R. Couri Hay
persons.context: Publicist who had recent conversations with Epstein about improving his reputation and Epstein's assertions about his conduct; subject of a subpoena attachment.

connections.description: Epstein had conversations with Hay about improving his reputation and discussed the nature of his prior conduct.
Prosecutor coordinating with FBI agent on investigation matters including meetings and subpoenas.
Individuals who previously worked with Epstein and may have information about coercive sexual encounters.

events.title: Email coordination on Epstein investigation
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney emails FBI to arrange meetings with former Epstein associates and discusses subpoena for publicist R. Couri Hay.

events.title: Epstein's conversation with R. Couri Hay
events.description: Epstein told publicist R. Couri Hay that what he was convicted of did not constitute pedophilia, referring to the girls as 'tweens and teens'.

events.title: New York Times stories referencing Hay
events.description: Two stories in the New York Times referenced publicist R. Couri Hay's recent conversations with Epstein about his reputation.

keyFacts: Prosecutors were seeking to meet with individuals who previously worked with Epstein and may have been victims of coercive sexual encounters with Epstein and/or his associates.
Epstein told publicist R. Couri Hay in April 2019 that his conviction did not constitute pedophilia, describing the girls as 'tweens and teens'.
A subpoena was prepared for R. Couri Hay to compel his cooperation if he declined informal interview.
The email indicates ongoing federal investigation into Epstein's conduct in July 2019, shortly before his arrest.
The communication shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and FBI in the Epstein investigation.
